subject: Data
title: The Spaghetti Chart Problem
description: A quick, practical guide to The Spaghetti Chart Problem.

hook.text: A chart with 15 overlapping colored lines looks like a bowl of spaghetti. Nobody can read anything.

buildup.text: Overloading a chart with too many data series makes it technically complete but practically useless.

discovery.text: The deception is unintentional but real: viewers give up trying to read it and accept whatever narrative is offered.

twist.text: Complexity can be a weapon. Present overwhelming data and people defer to your interpretation.

climax.text: Clarity is a design choice. Every unreadable chart is a missed opportunity â€” or a deliberate obfuscation.

punchline.text: If you can't read the chart, that might be the point.

quiz.question: Why can overly complex charts be deceptive?
options: Viewers give up and accept the presented narrative uncritically
